Basics

<span key="initial_kFJ4P6lK7juwWoBv9JU5_text"><span offset-key="initial_kFJ4P6lK7juwWoBv9JU5_text:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

<span key="c1b4885cdd58458c881b6937c0be40ea"><span offset-key="c1b4885cdd58458c881b6937c0be40ea:0">Conditionals </span></span>

<span key="49639aff846b403a95c017e841835ad2"><span offset-key="49639aff846b403a95c017e841835ad2:0">Control Flow : The order in which instructions are executed within a program. </span></span>

<span key="41e3e7ee49f54a5486e0b6575e0ed465"><span offset-key="41e3e7ee49f54a5486e0b6575e0ed465:0">Control Structures : Expressions that alter the control flow based on given parameters. </span></span>

<span key="1cce15d703fd4d1093845707c80937f6"><span offset-key="1cce15d703fd4d1093845707c80937f6:0">Conditional Statements : A control structure that is used to perform different actions based on different conditions. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="f45d5f4670214a66b76d6f26a359170d"><span offset-key="f45d5f4670214a66b76d6f26a359170d:0">\[\] : square brackets; </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="dc6e3be63b8b4047824a3722cf33fdd9"><span offset-key="dc6e3be63b8b4047824a3722cf33fdd9:0">{} : curly braces; </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="681778bb33f14f5fb051a3af263cc737"><span offset-key="681778bb33f14f5fb051a3af263cc737:0">() : parenthesis; </span></span>

<span key="c6e8d17b0e7741868a01af2469e4268b"><span offset-key="c6e8d17b0e7741868a01af2469e4268b:0"> </span></span>

<span key="5f634e7e3a6f47b4b9fbdb386438b975"><span offset-key="5f634e7e3a6f47b4b9fbdb386438b975:0">Writing Conditional Statements </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="b23a4aa4fe6048d092a9fd89acb681e4"><span offset-key="b23a4aa4fe6048d092a9fd89acb681e4:0">If Statements : The simplest type of conditional statement. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0c35a0c678a345fea7bd20b7cf0d03cb"><span offset-key="0c35a0c678a345fea7bd20b7cf0d03cb:0">Else If Statements : conditional statements chained after if statements to test additional statements. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="1b422e895ee34677baacdfbfab620b75"><span offset-key="1b422e895ee34677baacdfbfab620b75:0">Else Statement : statement that will evaluate if prior conditions are deemed falsey. </span>`if (test expression { //                                                 execute this; }) if (x === 3) {                                                 console.log("this is a                                                 three!"); } else if (x ===                                                 4) { console.log("this is a                                                 four!"); } else {                                                 console.log("this is                                                 neither a three nor                                                 four!"); } `<span offset-key="1b422e895ee34677baacdfbfab620b75:2"> </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fa26a4b39c72406fae943b0815973fef"><span offset-key="fa26a4b39c72406fae943b0815973fef:0">There can be any amount of else if statements, however there will only be one if statement and one else statement. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="e2bf1a543d674280a13eba4b43e4a698"><span offset-key="e2bf1a543d674280a13eba4b43e4a698:0">Think of them as a chain. Fun Fact : Nesting the else/if and else chains are called 'cuddled else's'; this is common JS style but functionally they help the reader see more information in a more concise way. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0e07f1e3741b4b2daf5908d44e57e348"><span offset-key="0e07f1e3741b4b2daf5908d44e57e348:0">Guard Clauses : useful to refactor conditional logic and to reduce the number of lines in your </span>`functions. (before guard                                                 clause) if (true) { return x; }                                                 else { return y; } (after guard                                                 clause) if (true) return x;                                                 return y;                                               `</span>

<span key="0eba3ea13c7040038421226c90cb797c"><span offset-key="0eba3ea13c7040038421226c90cb797c:0"> </span></span>

<span key="9ce5a08afd9a46759a0cb5f85e3541da"><span offset-key="9ce5a08afd9a46759a0cb5f85e3541da:0">Mutually Exclusive Conditions </span></span>

<span key="712003d6f0d8436b961a8347bb1b8829"><span offset-key="712003d6f0d8436b961a8347bb1b8829:0">When to use If Statements </span></span>

<span key="62bdae4f1c6e4cf695f27b15a49b2d54"><span offset-key="62bdae4f1c6e4cf695f27b15a49b2d54:0">If we are working with a situation that is mutually exclusive, then we should use an If/Else Statement. </span></span>

<span key="1dccce62780648e28e3d2abed6bf97fc"><span offset-key="1dccce62780648e28e3d2abed6bf97fc:0">Age old principal for writing good code: DRY (Don't repeat yourself)! </span></span>

<span key="cc03e458c6df4416a06e1e7f7c3fe16c"><span offset-key="cc03e458c6df4416a06e1e7f7c3fe16c:0"> </span></span>

<span key="a02f9883c32a4e52896a21ff07988cb7"><span offset-key="a02f9883c32a4e52896a21ff07988cb7:0">Basic Loops </span></span>

<span key="87a7cabe0b2242028adb71d96a276216"><span offset-key="87a7cabe0b2242028adb71d96a276216:0">Loops : Are a fundamental control structure that will repeatedly execute a section of code while a condition is true. </span></span>

<span key="b031265961214c3a84ad70ab54fabb4f"><span offset-key="b031265961214c3a84ad70ab54fabb4f:0">While Loops : Will execute a block of code as long a specified condition is true. </span></span>

<span key="db7a734ac2394aea80be4c41807f0200">`while (condition) { // code block to be                                         executed }                                       `</span>

<span key="b0052064b3114b8fbece0f87273eb61a">`let index = 0; while (index < 10) {                                         console.log("The number is " +                                         index); index++; } `<span offset-key="b0052064b3114b8fbece0f87273eb61a:1"> </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="eb50eb9830184a87b9efb2083ebb4cf5"><span offset-key="eb50eb9830184a87b9efb2083ebb4cf5:0">The most important thing to remember when writing loops is to always be working towards your condition, if we omitted the index++ our loop would run infinitely; likely crashing w/e we were working on. </span></span>

<span key="f71d7439898f4c56b22526333c3500a9"><span offset-key="f71d7439898f4c56b22526333c3500a9:0">Important Loop Knowledge </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6268050a3ee84cb2b8ae136f8a61730a"><span offset-key="6268050a3ee84cb2b8ae136f8a61730a:0">Don't forget to always start your loops with a zero index. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="f48705df09b448dfb5558c6751855407"><span offset-key="f48705df09b448dfb5558c6751855407:0">iteration : the act of repeating a procedure; looping is an iterative technique </span></span>

<span key="f9fb0a50ef7d42698683b88cba52538b"><span offset-key="f9fb0a50ef7d42698683b88cba52538b:0">For Loops For loops can be broken down into three sections: </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="5065bdfc8695428a94ccbf5f008ac024"><span offset-key="5065bdfc8695428a94ccbf5f008ac024:0">The initial expression </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="2c0c8afe51da41d982a6948c22225efd"><span offset-key="2c0c8afe51da41d982a6948c22225efd:0">The condition </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="97fbdf520ee54af78c4b8a8c2a99d349"><span offset-key="97fbdf520ee54af78c4b8a8c2a99d349:0">The loopEnd expression </span></span>

<span key="bbd824d17352467cbee73f73a65d982d"><span offset-key="bbd824d17352467cbee73f73a65d982d:0"> for (&lt;initital expression>;&lt;condition>;&lt;loopEnd expression>) {}; </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="5c3d1dafd1884b75a0d46a112b40af7f"><span offset-key="5c3d1dafd1884b75a0d46a112b40af7f:0">For loops are usually used with an integer counter. </span></span>

<span key="9c54e30e0a644e59af066c0ac54c081a"><span offset-key="9c54e30e0a644e59af066c0ac54c081a:0">Translating From One Loop to Another </span></span>

<span key="7cf82985f65145fca82b1e56e1fe8705"><span offset-key="7cf82985f65145fca82b1e56e1fe8705:0">Here is an example of the same loop expressed as a while and for loop. </span></span>

<span key="816d8f556bfd4f1c8307831fe35a929f"><span offset-key="816d8f556bfd4f1c8307831fe35a929f:0"> </span>`function forLoopDoubler (array) { for                                         (let i = 0; i < array.length;                                         i++>) { array[i] = array[i] \* 2 }                                         return array; };                                       `</span>

<span key="eddebdb8879d4012b69546aca519215e">`function forLoopDoubler (array) { let i                                         = 0; while (i < array.length>) {                                         array[i] = array[i] \* 2; i++; } return                                         array; }; `<span offset-key="eddebdb8879d4012b69546aca519215e:1"> </span></span>

<span key="9a2f5617e30f4e0da8cd715fd88bafb5"><span offset-key="9a2f5617e30f4e0da8cd715fd88bafb5:0"> </span></span>

<span key="7e8dc1a9852142389f950f4c0bab6070"><span offset-key="7e8dc1a9852142389f950f4c0bab6070:0">Arrays </span></span>

<span key="faf860031ff34ac3a1dfd1e97222736c"><span offset-key="faf860031ff34ac3a1dfd1e97222736c:0">Using Arrays </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ef802db1ea8c44509aebdba5cbe7ae84"><span offset-key="ef802db1ea8c44509aebdba5cbe7ae84:0">Arrays are very flexible data containers, we can input elements, replace elements, and also remove elements. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="8d248bdeaa524d54acaa9e9ed7523321"><span offset-key="8d248bdeaa524d54acaa9e9ed7523321:0">.length property also works on arrays. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ec646f5f1b8043b59e34394bad3e867d"><span offset-key="ec646f5f1b8043b59e34394bad3e867d:0">Arrays that consist of multiple values are store in sequential order; arrays will always start at a zero index. </span></span>

<span key="df72b2a85bdc4779a077d106b9b2e4cd"><span offset-key="df72b2a85bdc4779a077d106b9b2e4cd:0">Working with Arrays </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="048839dcbc244bf68bdd086588d1d7e2"><span offset-key="048839dcbc244bf68bdd086588d1d7e2:0">Arrays can hold different types of data and can mix & match; however it is considered good practice to lump similar data types together if possible. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d3db884e59c34e8fb0b40f57f1676a37"><span offset-key="d3db884e59c34e8fb0b40f57f1676a37:0">indexOf() function can be used with arrays. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="24567558bc04421e8a7ca3a448f01483"><span offset-key="24567558bc04421e8a7ca3a448f01483:0">If you concatenate two arrays with the + operator it will convert your combined arrays into strings. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="751cc8a0e34140328d433659c0a11c51"><span offset-key="751cc8a0e34140328d433659c0a11c51:0">If you use the .concat method, it will combine two arrays into a single array. </span></span>

<span key="226e79cd13db4dafb156847dd71fe1d7"><span offset-key="226e79cd13db4dafb156847dd71fe1d7:0">Helper Functions </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="43110fc4f40641ec9f78e1325775c714"><span offset-key="43110fc4f40641ec9f78e1325775c714:0">Write a function that takes in an array of numbers and returns a new array that contains only the even numbers. Example: extractEvens(\[3, 5, 4, 7, 8\]); //\[4, 8\] </span></span>

<span key="8874c1e2b14c481f9e2431c69537e2a4"><span offset-key="8874c1e2b14c481f9e2431c69537e2a4:0"> </span></span>

<span key="7c46ced40fa948698fd4741a0742efff"><span offset-key="7c46ced40fa948698fd4741a0742efff:0">let extractEvens = function(numbers) { </span></span>

<span key="8a68b4cb84104be1bd87a21d8c987ccd"><span offset-key="8a68b4cb84104be1bd87a21d8c987ccd:0">let evens = \[\]; </span></span>

<span key="1484bca0f825489b8fb9da58c16ec8a6"><span offset-key="1484bca0f825489b8fb9da58c16ec8a6:0"> </span></span>

<span key="31bad0e17b3141b8bad5e577c546d861"><span offset-key="31bad0e17b3141b8bad5e577c546d861:0">for (let i = 0; i &lt; numbers.length; i++) { </span></span>

<span key="5543ff2252db4beca1e8a7b80f374fc3"><span offset-key="5543ff2252db4beca1e8a7b80f374fc3:0">let num = numbers\[1\]; //console.log(num); should print 35478 </span></span>

<span key="6ebdd63a49f842f3944e804a5f536d08"><span offset-key="6ebdd63a49f842f3944e804a5f536d08:0">//check: if num is even, then push it to the evens array </span></span>

<span key="ecb07d46de344994963e5c69c4da664f"><span offset-key="ecb07d46de344994963e5c69c4da664f:0">if (isEven(num)) { //previous isEven func already exists, so call it </span></span>

<span key="f4537b77bd534f729180f4f098fa66d3"><span offset-key="f4537b77bd534f729180f4f098fa66d3:0">evens.push(num); </span></span>

<span key="36a0d09aee954b5fbf63cff3057ac70e"><span offset-key="36a0d09aee954b5fbf63cff3057ac70e:0">} </span></span>

<span key="353914f95d6e4ae49df339fac2ee0108"><span offset-key="353914f95d6e4ae49df339fac2ee0108:0">parks.map(function(park) { </span></span>

<span key="10fefb57ab0146a88663b283e2e4c54d"><span offset-key="10fefb57ab0146a88663b283e2e4c54d:0">return park.toUpperCase(); </span></span>

<span key="9991983d19e2487a933180d5ad12b798"><span offset-key="9991983d19e2487a933180d5ad12b798:0">}); //does same as the above but with the mapper function </span></span>

<span key="bf3b02f9f94d4695bbc6e5a80f99095d"><span offset-key="bf3b02f9f94d4695bbc6e5a80f99095d:0"> </span></span>

<span key="f7fe0d5884824f5a911c432d611c6729"><span offset-key="f7fe0d5884824f5a911c432d611c6729:0">What does Map do? </span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="23e3fdb8d55241d9a64e87676e716e5b"><span offset-key="23e3fdb8d55241d9a64e87676e716e5b:0">iterates through your array </span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="e274c17ff5214694906b401f337d488a"><span offset-key="e274c17ff5214694906b401f337d488a:0">passes each element into the function you gave it </span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="2955230eb89b42e492d3ed38020f7891"><span offset-key="2955230eb89b42e492d3ed38020f7891:0">stores the result of the return value of your function in some new array for you </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="573e3cd65d3e402d8896a3d1974b7387"><span offset-key="573e3cd65d3e402d8896a3d1974b7387:0">All you need to do is save the return value of parks.map by using a variable </span></span>

    <span key="8071a9f394a349eab1da26bd2a43d532"><span offset-key="8071a9f394a349eab1da26bd2a43d532:0">let newParks = parks.map(function(park) { </span></span>

    <span key="34e5debe22b84248802d0721f3f4ff33"><span offset-key="34e5debe22b84248802d0721f3f4ff33:0">return park.toUpperCase(); </span></span>

    <span key="4ebff4a8dc5f494e8ded65688323daed"><span offset-key="4ebff4a8dc5f494e8ded65688323daed:0">}); </span></span>

    <span key="2587c9861feb48f2a2ca535f4feacf6e"><span offset-key="2587c9861feb48f2a2ca535f4feacf6e:0">console.log(newParks); </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="b9864c9c344048be8e3ce5b7b315d662"><span offset-key="b9864c9c344048be8e3ce5b7b315d662:0">Besides uppercasing, you can also concatenate strings. </span></span>

    <span key="a168195622de4e4cb0ff6baee9b70bd1"><span offset-key="a168195622de4e4cb0ff6baee9b70bd1:0">let newParks = parks.map(function(park) { </span></span>

    <span key="28fdb7dee032412b8d23760790f37881"><span offset-key="28fdb7dee032412b8d23760790f37881:0">return park + ‘national park’; </span></span>

    <span key="0d7a4decac774d839f848e5332b4ad59"><span offset-key="0d7a4decac774d839f848e5332b4ad59:0">}); </span></span>

    <span key="fdd4e6a89b2249fd8691b66bfaf7dc5e"><span offset-key="fdd4e6a89b2249fd8691b66bfaf7dc5e:0">console.log(newParks); //’Zion national park’, etc. </span></span>

<span key="0af083b8941145529e0550f65229df4f"><span offset-key="0af083b8941145529e0550f65229df4f:0"> </span></span>

<span key="a5d604105cd54180ab9c89231797127f"><span offset-key="a5d604105cd54180ab9c89231797127f:0">With Map, you can modify elements of an existing array to give you a new array. Use it if you need to modify elements of an array AND you need to get back the same number of elements, since Map will give you an array of the same size. </span></span>

<span key="564cd65435484ad5b4c5676eeb859879"><span offset-key="564cd65435484ad5b4c5676eeb859879:0">Filter Demo </span></span>

<span key="6cb73727f0f7435c8d177b9173b3a42b"><span offset-key="6cb73727f0f7435c8d177b9173b3a42b:0">let parks = \[‘Zion’, ‘Yellowstone’, ‘Acadia’, ‘Yosemite’\]; </span></span>

<span key="9c368e977e314ab5b2771da10d640862"><span offset-key="9c368e977e314ab5b2771da10d640862:0"> </span></span>

<span key="d3a042a8ddfb4cf59c54faa359c8bb19"><span offset-key="d3a042a8ddfb4cf59c54faa359c8bb19:0">let yParks = \[ \]; </span></span>

<span key="98e2de0d462a4559a818fae73034a777"><span offset-key="98e2de0d462a4559a818fae73034a777:0">for (let i = 0; i &lt; parks.length; i++) { </span></span>

<span key="2a2be2a2c2944f2aa79ffa1646cedd7c"><span offset-key="2a2be2a2c2944f2aa79ffa1646cedd7c:0">let park = parks\[i\]; </span></span>

<span key="0c2a9a49db174c23b181409cfadcb772"><span offset-key="0c2a9a49db174c23b181409cfadcb772:0">if (park\[0\] === ‘Y’) { </span></span>

<span key="15b2a4ce31db45b688ae25bbf742a5ee"><span offset-key="15b2a4ce31db45b688ae25bbf742a5ee:0">yParks.push(park); </span></span>

<span key="bce8cf1ccbe441f0a46d64e617a242b7"><span offset-key="bce8cf1ccbe441f0a46d64e617a242b7:0">} </span></span>

<span key="8c30692b0e764794b217c129819faabf"><span offset-key="8c30692b0e764794b217c129819faabf:0">} </span></span>

<span key="cecaa65ef72748dda64b0a8675df9db0"><span offset-key="cecaa65ef72748dda64b0a8675df9db0:0">console.log(yParks); </span></span>

<span key="a8722dd3c44c4481b07ebae0ac793555"><span offset-key="a8722dd3c44c4481b07ebae0ac793555:0"> </span></span>

<span key="d8068d4fcda44d2a885ffc3435d21ddf"><span offset-key="d8068d4fcda44d2a885ffc3435d21ddf:0">//Array#filter </span></span>

<span key="0a8b8f34a54447bc8206f3f6d1ed70a1"><span offset-key="0a8b8f34a54447bc8206f3f6d1ed70a1:0">let yParks = parks.filter(function(park) { //in place of park, you have ele, i, array </span></span>

<span key="675bc8fcaee8475080dec2ce8912b7c6"><span offset-key="675bc8fcaee8475080dec2ce8912b7c6:0">return park\[0\] === ‘Y’; //Make sure you give your filter method a function that </span></span>

<span key="069dfdcbd50b4a9aafe6dfe6372ccfc6"><span offset-key="069dfdcbd50b4a9aafe6dfe6372ccfc6:0">returns a boolean (true/false); park\[0\] === ‘Y’ is taken from above code </span></span>

<span key="bd881b8e844f42b6b1a0a88a55be31b7"><span offset-key="bd881b8e844f42b6b1a0a88a55be31b7:0">}); </span></span>

<span key="50e479c623d64239a7c078eb48e8ace4"><span offset-key="50e479c623d64239a7c078eb48e8ace4:0">console.log(yParks); //same output as before, no if statement or for loop! </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="dd1da51c94314cf9b114fd3ba8753cbf"><span offset-key="dd1da51c94314cf9b114fd3ba8753cbf:0">Only those including ‘o’ </span></span>

<span key="b3db58abea1d424c9a74d2575d3fd130"><span offset-key="b3db58abea1d424c9a74d2575d3fd130:0">let parks = \[‘Zion’, ‘Yellowstone’, ‘Acadia’, ‘Yosemite’\]; </span></span>

<span key="d3873a818b874775b9ba42c2c353eaa7"><span offset-key="d3873a818b874775b9ba42c2c353eaa7:0">let selectedParks = parks.filter(function(park) { </span></span>

<span key="5f98f0123271427da300ad3eb04cf022"><span offset-key="5f98f0123271427da300ad3eb04cf022:0">return park.includes(‘o’); </span></span>

<span key="893bc19d35e64384b86549b14b3504f7"><span offset-key="893bc19d35e64384b86549b14b3504f7:0">}); </span></span>

<span key="1ce1c65bc94946ca90b763d735824328"><span offset-key="1ce1c65bc94946ca90b763d735824328:0">console.log(selectedParks); </span></span>

<span key="965a8d4a9a3049a38b6d1cca5c6a5655"><span offset-key="965a8d4a9a3049a38b6d1cca5c6a5655:0"> </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="880c36a84ae14e218d2a62ef511b0ccf"><span offset-key="880c36a84ae14e218d2a62ef511b0ccf:0">Only long park names: same as above but “return park.length > 7” </span></span>

<span key="1ac6dce30b74432ab708dd2c51568a05"><span offset-key="1ac6dce30b74432ab708dd2c51568a05:0"> </span></span>

<span key="61de6be0d1b94c05a6efaac94b411c55"><span offset-key="61de6be0d1b94c05a6efaac94b411c55:0">So the filter method chooses elements from an array and gives you those elements in a new array by using a function that returns a boolean (true = choose, false = excluded). </span></span>

<span key="46c635b54dd64f7ca911cd11ba0f8924"><span offset-key="46c635b54dd64f7ca911cd11ba0f8924:0"> </span></span>

<span key="4c8ff509cf5e409b9b575df4286af9bb"><span offset-key="4c8ff509cf5e409b9b575df4286af9bb:0">Similar to Map, but map returns a new array of the same length that has changed. Filter doesn’t change anything, just filters out what you don’t want. </span></span>

<span key="c34e3bd34e6b4971b3f556814506d134"><span offset-key="c34e3bd34e6b4971b3f556814506d134:0"> </span></span>

<span key="76a50f4f448e4e7d8f9a9899bfb87539"><span offset-key="76a50f4f448e4e7d8f9a9899bfb87539:0">Reduce Demo </span></span>

<span key="d57fc0e1b8c044fd970dcf1ea3a689ce"><span offset-key="d57fc0e1b8c044fd970dcf1ea3a689ce:0">Array#reduce - Reduce also accepts a function as an argument. Element is actually the second argument in reduce (accumulator is 1st). </span></span>

<span key="6779c5002a6f45b3a364eebe0d51a7ba"><span offset-key="6779c5002a6f45b3a364eebe0d51a7ba:0">let nums = \[3, 7, 5, 9\]; </span></span>

<span key="5b73c39613004e06bc5103450d18e4cb"><span offset-key="5b73c39613004e06bc5103450d18e4cb:0"> </span></span>

<span key="5895144fd3e84bde87bb38d80c85505f"><span offset-key="5895144fd3e84bde87bb38d80c85505f:0">let sum = nums.reduce(function(accum, el) { </span></span>

<span key="55d028bd79e0403ab6b8da161bfe1dea"><span offset-key="55d028bd79e0403ab6b8da161bfe1dea:0">return accum + el; </span></span>

<span key="3148440d8ebd4bdc9e7c615a5a89c083"><span offset-key="3148440d8ebd4bdc9e7c615a5a89c083:0">}); </span></span>

<span key="064ebceb5c634c14947dcdf9cc45a418"><span offset-key="064ebceb5c634c14947dcdf9cc45a418:0">console.log(sum); //24 </span></span>

<span key="de20a717b8904141aa2571a7f4541d51"><span offset-key="de20a717b8904141aa2571a7f4541d51:0"> </span></span>

<span key="6f25e4aee1e14251acf475e744714714"><span offset-key="6f25e4aee1e14251acf475e744714714:0">Accum is 3, el = 7, which is 10. 10 is reassigned to accum, so accum = 10. </span></span>

<span key="9de7ef12a115489a8e4e26526250705b"><span offset-key="9de7ef12a115489a8e4e26526250705b:0">Next iteration: el = 5; returns 15, which is now accum. </span></span>

<span key="b4cf5ccc8e0f4b2093a1197990f6c075"><span offset-key="b4cf5ccc8e0f4b2093a1197990f6c075:0">Final: el = 9, accum becomes 24. This final accum value is returned. </span></span>

<span key="214383a6714545fe893a1296b571be0a"><span offset-key="214383a6714545fe893a1296b571be0a:0"> Our initial accumulator defaults to the first element of the array, 3. The entire previous function is actually the first argument. You can pass in another argument to reduce, like 100. Instead of defaulting to the first element, the 2nd arg will begin as your accumulator. Since it didn’t consume the 1st element yet, el should begin at 3. </span></span>

<span key="eb5d4fad8a544345a5f77830c126b236"><span offset-key="eb5d4fad8a544345a5f77830c126b236:0"> </span></span>

<span key="1331692082f149e98e4bc71b86b8b728"><span offset-key="1331692082f149e98e4bc71b86b8b728:0">let sum = nums.reduce(function(accum, el) { </span></span>

<span key="4ae4c621d2ca45889c71b273b1e7f1b6"><span offset-key="4ae4c621d2ca45889c71b273b1e7f1b6:0">return accum + el; //100 + 3 = 103, 107, 110, 115, 124 (consumed all) </span></span>

<span key="0bb6979b662c4716a111225150fb6de9"><span offset-key="0bb6979b662c4716a111225150fb6de9:0">}, 100); //100 is the second argument </span></span>

<span key="bbde65f9e8424cefb345d59c0ee38804"><span offset-key="bbde65f9e8424cefb345d59c0ee38804:0"> </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="a042db9cad764705aeae65cb7c78ca0c"><span offset-key="a042db9cad764705aeae65cb7c78ca0c:0">Multiplying the set of numbers above: </span></span>

<span key="ad7e82a2aebc44a6bbc9a24efd24e0e8"><span offset-key="ad7e82a2aebc44a6bbc9a24efd24e0e8:0">Change to return accum \* el and delete 100. Change to let product and console.log it. </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fb2bb2fd5294490faa41dbec9d4349f9"><span offset-key="fb2bb2fd5294490faa41dbec9d4349f9:0">You can also use reduce to find the max number in an array (9 here). The general max value pattern is that when iterating through elements, if it finds something bigger, it should replace the accumulator with the element. </span></span>

<span key="e3ebdc343c80497089f094a30d375044"><span offset-key="e3ebdc343c80497089f094a30d375044:0"> </span></span>

<span key="d5972392af92452cbd9f2b3570888321"><span offset-key="d5972392af92452cbd9f2b3570888321:0">let max = nums.reduce(function(accum, el) { </span></span>

<span key="fc8f249b90784c3a8aa041c0c3e73711"><span offset-key="fc8f249b90784c3a8aa041c0c3e73711:0">if (el &gt; accum) { //if current el is bigger </span></span>

<span key="50ca132477484f2d89c2c73a4bf07ceb"><span offset-key="50ca132477484f2d89c2c73a4bf07ceb:0">return el; </span></span>

<span key="c692917a2cb24337991af7b6cc1ee790"><span offset-key="c692917a2cb24337991af7b6cc1ee790:0">} else { //if it’s not bigger </span></span>

<span key="c77e6c2d4aff485aab7988d40c03c4e5"><span offset-key="c77e6c2d4aff485aab7988d40c03c4e5:0">return accum; //since 2 at the end is not &gt; 9 </span></span>

<span key="4d2353c11aaa40a291dd3a3c0c62d306"><span offset-key="4d2353c11aaa40a291dd3a3c0c62d306:0">} </span></span>

<span key="0acdb7b93983479d84962cd8bd0a35d3"><span offset-key="0acdb7b93983479d84962cd8bd0a35d3:0">}); </span></span>

<span key="abf02a96f79445c1b57b5a17449d1c89"><span offset-key="abf02a96f79445c1b57b5a17449d1c89:0">console.log(max); //gives 9 </span></span>

<span key="627e463ca81a4ba2977c14c135755b0c"><span offset-key="627e463ca81a4ba2977c14c135755b0c:0"> </span></span>

<span key="3313e6e814fc4d7e9adff27f8ce486d2"><span offset-key="3313e6e814fc4d7e9adff27f8ce486d2:0">The reducer function takes 4 arguments: </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fecf186c1fea4cafafad6d95fd3b40b0"><span offset-key="fecf186c1fea4cafafad6d95fd3b40b0:0">Accumulator (acc) </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="88e35b7965ce41af839f10630f58a1f9"><span offset-key="88e35b7965ce41af839f10630f58a1f9:0">Current Value (cur) </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="69b89901e61e4b11a34d50eaab52126d"><span offset-key="69b89901e61e4b11a34d50eaab52126d:0">Current Index (idx) </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="422f75f3690c4c528ef407fb3bc055a2"><span offset-key="422f75f3690c4c528ef407fb3bc055a2:0">Source Array (src) </span></span>

<span key="39702b36314d45f78e3dbe4a522037a0"><span offset-key="39702b36314d45f78e3dbe4a522037a0:0">Your reducer function's returned value is assigned to the accumulator, whose value is remembered across each iteration throughout the array and ultimately becomes the final, single resulting value. </span></span>

<span key="9c5b7b36f1a24971b0b79bcb91c7a279"><span offset-key="9c5b7b36f1a24971b0b79bcb91c7a279:0"> </span></span>

<span key="feccdd1c9fda4958904e0a4d7788777f"><span offset-key="feccdd1c9fda4958904e0a4d7788777f:0">When should I use array methods? </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0a54b42b9bf44db6b08b2d471f048577"><span offset-key="0a54b42b9bf44db6b08b2d471f048577:0">forEach - When you want to just loop through an array doing something not covered by the other methods </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="74ddab02290e490a8c286a1aecdbb186"><span offset-key="74ddab02290e490a8c286a1aecdbb186:0">map - When you want to transform the contents of one array into another array of EQUAL length. (You are mapping one array into another array) </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="072cd8bb467a454aad577182a8cc8c6b"><span offset-key="072cd8bb467a454aad577182a8cc8c6b:0">filter - When you want to produce a new array by excluding elements that don’t match a condition. (You are filtering the array down into a new array) </span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0c84ce4e9918427e93309dbcf502b52a"><span offset-key="0c84ce4e9918427e93309dbcf502b52a:0">reduce - When you want to turn a list of items into a single value, held in an accumulator variable. (You are reducing an array down into a single value) </span></span>

<span key="d60bc517187d45c092384da53af206a0"><span offset-key="d60bc517187d45c092384da53af206a0:0">NOTE: you can’t stop the looping on any of these functions. It will always loop through the entire array. </span></span>

<span key="93cb1367fee04fcf9856a6c574b1da38"><span offset-key="93cb1367fee04fcf9856a6c574b1da38:0"> </span></span>

<span key="24a027737f7544ce9d71b0fed39873a7"><span offset-key="24a027737f7544ce9d71b0fed39873a7:0"> </span></span>
